result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Robert Powers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No violent or disorderly contact with TRP or minor child. 
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.
Engage with mental health providers and continue treatment.

records.addlTxt: 2:38 PM Defendant Matthew R. Powers in court.  Attorney John K Smerlinski in court for Matthew R. Powers.  Attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to Counts 4 and 5; Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 1, 2 and 3 are dismissed and read in.  Court orders sentence withheld, 3 years probation, any treatment deemed necessary, no violent or disorderly contact with TRP or minor child, AODA, absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription, engage with mental health providers and continue treatment, costs due to Clerk of Court, 0 days sentence credit.

Officer John Martini of Janesville Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense opposes with argument. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set, bond to continue.
